hero.title: How We Helped an iGaming Provider Find 35 Warm Leads Through Cold Email
hero.description: From operator search to receiving 94 responses through personalized email campaigns

intro.title: About the Client
intro.description: A gaming software provider operating in the B2B iGaming segment - creating slots, live games, virtual products, and platforms. Due to NDA conditions, we cannot name the brand, but this is a company looking for new casino operators to license or sell their products to.

goals.title: Objective
list: interested in expanding their game portfolio

items.title: High Competition
items.description: The iGaming industry is highly competitive. Operators receive dozens of similar offers daily.

items.title: Complex Audience
items.description: We needed to find the right decision-makers - CEOs, Head of Operations, Business Development Managers.

items.title: Technical Requirements
items.description: Operators look for products with fast APIs, international certifications, and multi-language support.

items.title: Unique Value Proposition
items.description: It was necessary to highlight unique game mechanics and advantages among numerous competitors.

solutions.title: What We Did
solutions.description: We created a 5-email cold email campaign. The focus was on business personalization, clear UVP, and easy-to-execute call-to-action (demo, call, intro call).

items.title: Campaign Parameters
items.description:
â€¢ 2,000 contacts
â€¢ Open Rate - 60%
â€¢ Reply Rate - 3% (61 responses)

strategy.title: How We Built Communication
strategy.description: Each email was built with a clear structure:

sequences.title: personalization
sequences.description: mentioned specific operator pain points (lack of unique content, technical integration difficulties, need for certified software)

sequences.title: UVP
sequences.description: emphasis on provider's strengths - certification (e.g., MGA, Curacao), exclusive game mechanics, multi-language support, bonus modules

sequences.title: call to action
sequences.description: without being pushy, but with a clear next step - "Schedule a call", "Get a demo", "Give team intro"

testing.title: Segmentation and Lead Search
testing.description:
We didn't just take a database. Each contact went through filters based on several criteria:
â€“ geography (Europe, LatAm, Asia)
â€“ business size (from medium to large-scale operators)
â€“ vertical: live casino, slots, virtual sports, sportsbook

Contacts were found through:
â€“ Our team handled audience search and collection
â€“ We applied our proprietary development for scraping leads from various sources.

We targeted only decision-makers - CEOs, Head of Operations, Business Development Managers.

points.title: Strong UVP
points.description: The client had unique game mechanics, support for over 10 languages, fast API, and international certifications - and we highlighted all of this in every email.

points.title: Deep Understanding of Market Pain Points
points.description:
Operators need content that:

conclusion.title: Our Observations
conclusion.description:
â€¢ More than 60% of online casino revenue comes from only 10-15% of games - operators are looking for products that can become hits.
â€¢ Most platforms integrate new providers through APIs - speed and stability are critical here.
â€¢ Games certified for multiple jurisdictions (e.g., MGA, UKGC, ONJN) provide greater market access.
